TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit TaskCanceledException extends System.OperationCanceledException

Docs.summary: Represents an exception used to communicate task cancellation.
Docs.threadsafe: The <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException.Task%2A> property is thread-safe and may be used from multiple threads concurrently.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message that describes the error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error. This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.OperationCanceledException>:
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Threading.Tasks.Task task) cil managed

Docs.param: A task that has been canceled.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the that has been canceled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=248602).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the `innerException` parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string specified in `message`.|

Docs.summary: Gets the task associated with this exception.
Docs.value: A reference to the that is associated with this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks It is permissible for no Task to be associated with a <xref:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCanceledException>, in which case this property will return null.
This property is thread-safe and may be used from multiple threads concurrently.
